description: The death of God refers to both the absence of God in a post-Christian culture and the
death of Jesus on the cross. These two meanings have a significance for the religious and
non-religious alike. Students evaluate the challenges that the death of God has for the
concept of God, the meaning and purpose of Jesus, religious belief, reason, and the
secular by reading classical and contemporary theological work on the death of Jesus and
the death of God. Offered alternate years. Prerequisite: BTS-B.
fullname: The Death of God: Reason, Cross, and Theology
